title: Speedcast plotting major satellite capacity expansion
summary: Remote communications provider Speedcast is preparing to buy another sizable chunk of satellite capacity as demand soars beyond pre-pandemic levels.

title: South Korean rocket’s second launch rescheduled for June 21
summary: The second launch of South Korea’s first domestically built rocket is set for June 21, a delay of a week due to strong winds and a technical glitch.

title: Impulse Space raises an additional $10 million for orbital transfer vehicles
summary: In-space transportation company Impulse Space Propulsion, which raised $20 million in a seed round earlier this year, announced June 17 it raised another $10 million to help accelerate work on orbital transfer vehicles.

title: Getting SSA off the ground
summary: Investors are funding orbital solutions for tracking space objects.

title: SpaceX to kick off launch triple-header with record-breaking Falcon reuse
summary: SpaceX appears to be on track to launch a trio of Falcon 9 rockets in as few as 36 hours, beginning with...

title: SpaceX launches Starlink satellites on booster’s 13th flight
summary: SpaceX is launched yet another 53 Starlink satellites to low Earth orbit. The liftoff at 12:09 PM EDT (16:08 UTC) on Friday was from the historic Launch Complex 39A at NASA’s Kennedy Space Center in Florida. This mission marked SpaceX’s second launch of the month, its 24th launch of 2022, and the company’s 50th launch from Pad 39A.

title: Astronomers renew concerns about Starlink satellite brightness
summary: As SpaceX gears up for another launch of Starlink satellites, astronomers are concerned the company maybe backsliding in its efforts to reduce the brightness of those satellites.

title: SpaceX fires employees involved in letter rebuking Musk
summary: SpaceX has fired employees who helped write and distribute an open letter criticizing Chief Executive Officer Elon Musk's behavior, the New York Times reported on Friday, citing three employees with knowledge of the situation.

title: Astronomers want “strong finish” for SOFIA
summary: The organization that operates an airborne astronomical observatory that NASA is shutting down this year wants to end the project on a high note.

title: German military radar satellite ready for SpaceX rocket ride
summary: The first satellite in a billion-dollar program to provide the German military with improved radar surveillance imagery from space is set to rocket into a polar orbit Saturday from California’s Central Coast on a SpaceX Falcon 9 rocket.
